channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Victoria recorded 114 new cases and 11 deaths on Sunday, as NSW's CBD cluster prompts health alerts for venues across the city.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 73 new COVID-19 cases as health alerts issued for multiple inner-Sydney venues; Australian death toll jumps to 652

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: “Do you seriously wonder, Mr President, why this is the first time in decades that America has seen this level of violence?” Mayor Ted Wheeler asked.
item.title: Portland mayor pins blame on Trump for inciting violence after man is shot

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews has announced he will reveal a road map out of lockdown on Sunday, but has not revealed any further details, saying the COVID-19 case numbers for the coming week were 'critically important'.
item.title: Premier set to unveil COVID-19 road map out of lockdown on Sunday

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: A spokesman for the miner confirmed Mr Jacques arrived in Perth two weeks ago and had just completed two weeks in quarantine.
item.title: Rio chief executive Jean-Sébastien Jacques in WA to apologise to Juukan Gorge traditional owners

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: After being locked out of 129 of its stores in Westfield’s malls for 10 days, the fashion retailer behind Noni B has settled a bitter rental stoush with shopping centre owner Scentre Group.
item.title: Mosaic settles lockout rent stoush with Scentre Group

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Coronavirus restrictions have been eased for Auckland residents from Monday, though extra pre-cautions are still required compared to the rest of New Zealand.
item.title: Auckland coronavirus restrictions eased as Kiwis embrace face masks

item.description: This week the government will attempt to amend the Migration Act to give security officers the power to take away detainees' mobile phones.
item.title: A law to deprive immigration detainees of their only contact: Australia's shame before the world

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The latest alleged quarantine breach a Perth man who arrived from Brisbane on Friday night without an exemption to enter the state and was found at a Northbridge bar later that night surrounded by patrons.
item.title: More than 100 people charged with breaching WA's quarantine rules

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Erick Mombaerts has taken Melbourne City to the next level. Whether he stays or goes club must build on his foundations to challenge domestically and in Asia
item.title: Mombaerts creates strong platform, now City must build on it

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Six cases were in people in hotel quarantine while the remainder were in the community after the state recorded 14,232 tests in the reporting period.
item.title: NSW records 10 new cases; four linked to Sydney CBD cluster

item.description: If a future historian ever documents the work of The Church's Steve Kilbey they’d need to rewind the tape startlingly far.
item.title: Kilbey delights with a blast from the distant past

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: The female guard has been taken to Westmead Hospital after the "brutal attack".
item.title: 'Brutal attack': prison guard stabbed in back at Silverwater prison

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Bubs Australia will tap investors for a funding injection, announcing a capital raising before the market opened on Monday and a trading halt in its shares.
item.title: Infant formula company Bubs seeks funds to grow bigger

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: The Fed turned its back on nearly 40 years of prioritising a low inflation rate with its bold new policy. The financial markets’ reaction told us a lot.
item.title: Why markets barely blinked at Fed's new direction

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Police are searching a Gold Coast property for Ms Greer's remains or key evidence after a "credible" tip-off.
item.title: Bikie partner murdered Queensland mum Tina Greer: Police

item.description: The Queensland Premier's hardline stance on border closures looked politically risky two months ago but now it may prove an election-winning strategy.
item.title: Reward and cost of a COVID-19 election in Queensland

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei has quit its major sponsorship of rugby league club the Canberra Raiders, decrying the "continued negative business environment" towards the company in Australia.
item.title: Huawei quits as Canberra Raiders' main sponsor

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The deal will cement the big four banks' exit from the super industry following a long list of scandals and mounting customer remediation bills.
item.title: IOOF reaches $1.4b deal to buy NAB's wealth business

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: From the moment she was exposed to jazz, Judy Bailey's life was changed.
item.title: How Judy Bailey's six-month stay became 60 years

item.description: The week in photos from our award winning photographers and regular contributing photographers at The Age.
item.title: The Age photos of the week, August 30, 2020

item.description: The lieutenant-colonel was detained by France's General Directorate for Internal Security, as he was about to return to Italy after a holiday in France.
item.title: French army officer charged with spying for Russia

item.description: Confronting a climate crisis that threatens the fossil fuel industry, oil companies are racing to make more plastic. But that creates a need to find somewhere to dump its waste.
item.title: Dumping ground: Big Oil's plan to flood Africa with plastic

item.description: Law enforcement officials never fully investigated Trump's own relationship with Russia, even though some FBI counterintelligence investigators were alarmed.
item.title: US Justice Department shielded Trump from Russia probe, ex-officials say

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland's Premier will set up a new unit this week to field medical exemption requests for New South Wales' residents needing treatment across the border.
item.title: New unit to deal with health exemptions on Queensland's border

item.description: The actor seemingly obliterated the curse of so many never seeing themselves as a hero - the hero.
item.title: Chadwick Boseman embodied the black heroes of our past and gave us one for the future

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Glenn Maxwell has crunched a century in Australia's warm-up ODI clash in England, as David Warner shows no signs of slowing down.
item.title: Warner 'bullish' as Maxwell makes a statement with century

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: It took 100 minutes to execute and required his chest to score, but Rhyan Grant's grand final winner came straight from the training ground of the Sky Blues.
item.title: Grant's chest goal hatched straight from Sydney FC's training ground

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 was ahead 0.2 per cent in early afternoon trade. Health, consumer staples, and materials were dragging, while energy and property stocks were up
item.title: Energy, tech shares lift ASX; NZX cops fifth day of cyber attacks

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Heavy winds again battered the state on Sunday causing more than 2000 homes to lose power.
item.title: About 4000 homes remain without power as heavy winds hit state again

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: A report by London barrister Andrew Burns QC into harassment complaints against Boe Pahari lists nine key allegations made by Julia Szlakowski and confirms he was satisfied her account of events was true and accurate.
item.title: AMP harassment victim's allegations credible, investigation finds

item.description: A look at the follies, foibles and joys of the human race through the eyes of cartoonist Michael Leunig. Buy prints from Michael Leunig at https://www.thestore.com.au/category/artists/michael-leunig. Join us on Facebook at the Michael Leunig Appreciation Page.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Michael Leunig

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 31, 2020

item.description: Whoever ultimately emerges as Japan's new leader has a long list of jobs. First up is dealing with an economy that has nosedived.
item.title: Drowning in debt: Japan's next leader will inherit an economic mess

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Last year it was ABC journalist and author Leigh Sales who copped it at Perth's Disrupted Festival of Ideas, this year controversial Alice Springs politician Jacinta Price seems to be on the receiving end.
item.title: ‘We don’t believe in censorship’: Controversial Aboriginal commentator to lead WA festival amid fear of backlash from Noongar people

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Caught on the wrong side of the state's 'hard border' these West Australians are angry, frustrated and abandoned. They're not high-flying business people or celebrities, they just want to come home.
item.title: Hard border: 'The walls close in' for West Australians on the wrong side of state's iron ore curtain

item.description: Beijing is so confident of its inoculations that authorities have been administering vaccines for more than a month before clinical studies conclude, authorities revealed last week.
item.title: China claims to take lead in global race to develop vaccine

item.description: We've got you covered for a seven-race card on a good track.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Tamworth on Monday

item.description: Banksy posted a video of the rescue mission on Instagram on Saturday that showed images of migrants in distress.
item.title: Banksy-funded rescue vessel evacuated after distress call

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The black, red and yellow of the Aboriginal flag shone like a beacon on the sleeve of the Wallabies first two Indigenous jerseys. Not anymore.
item.title: 'It's so divisive now': Aboriginal flag copyright drama hits rugby

item.description: Dozens of officers, some holding protective shields, faced off with the revellers in Thetford Forest but despite a few scuffles, the party was largely dispersed peacefully.
item.title: Police break up forest rave in England amid COVID-19 clampdown

item.description: After months of drama and doubt, Nicolai Tangen is finally set to become the chief executive of Norway's $US1.2 trillion wealth fund. He says staying cool in the face of unpopularity was key.
item.title: The CEO of world's biggest wealth fund says you have to be 'capable of being unpopular'

item.description: The crowd appeared to be at least as large as those of the previous two Sundays, when estimates put the protesters' numbers at more than 100,000.
item.title: Belarus president hunkers down as crowds demand he leave

item.description: Kate Bedingfield, Biden's deputy campaign manager, said on Fox News Sunday that President Donald Trump has been inciting violence around protests all summer.
item.title: Joe Biden to address Trump's stoking of violence in campaign swing

item.description: Lord & Taylor, one of the country's oldest department store chains, is going out of business after filing for bankruptcy earlier this month.
item.title: After nearly 200 years, US giant Lord & Taylor goes out of business

item.description: The Republican president, who has taken a hard stand against racial protests in the country, will visit the Midwestern city on Tuesday, US time.
item.title: Trump's planned visit may worsen protests in Kenosha, say Democrats

item.description: Coronavirus-related deaths in the US were nearing 180,000 on Sunday as states hit hard by a surge of infections earlier in the summer continued to report high numbers of daily fatalities.
item.title: US death toll approaches 180,000 as FDA staff fear COVID-19 is being politicised

item.description: Julian Alaphilippe outsmarted Mitchelton-Scott's Adam Yates to win a sprint finish on stage 2 and claim the yellow jersey.
item.title: Alaphilippe claims the Tour de France yellow jersey with stage 2 win
